section.title: Overview
section.para: ACC_RADIUS module is used to account transaction information to RADIUS server. It binds to ACC module API and uses the same accounting mechanisms as for other backends.
Therefore you need this module just to send accounting data to a RADIUS server - for more documentation regarding accounting, see the ACC readme.

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The module depends on the following modules (in the other words the listed modules must be loaded before this module):
acc - accounting module

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para: The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:

section.title: radius_config (string)
section.para: This parameter is radius specific. Path to radius client configuration file, set the referred config file correctly and specify there address of server, shared secret (should equal that in /usr/local/etc/raddb/clients for freeRadius servers) and dictionary, see etc for an example of config file and dictionary.
If the parameter is set to empty string, the RADIUS accounting support will be disabled (even if compiled).

section.title: radius_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account a transaction -- RADIUS specific.

section.title: radius_missed_flag (integer)
section.para: Request flag which needs to be set to account missed calls -- RADIUS specific.

section.title: service_type (integer)
section.para: Radius service type used for accounting.

section.title: radius_extra (string)
section.para: Extra values to be logged via RADIUS - RADIUS specific.
